resources.string: <g id="female_lookConcern" />You must be wary in these parts, traveler.<g id="female_explainS" /> The nearby farm has fallen to the Lost. If you value your soul, I would suggest staying safely behind the walls in town.
<g id="female_youknowS" />Greetings traveler, you have the air of one new to Aeternum,<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" /> so I pray the fires of hope still burn within your heart.
<g id="female_worry" />I have taken on a daunting quest to bring aid to the needy… but I am the one now in need of assistance.
Hope and Service
Covenant Initiation Quest: Florina has requested you aid Feldan save what you can at Olcott Farm and then meet her at the Church in Everfall.
"What do you need help with?"
<g id="female_worry" />It's painful to admit, but when the Olcott farm fell to the Lost, <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I offered to help them reclaim their valuables.
<g id="female_youknow" />I came here with the old man, Feldan Olcott, but the Withered are too many.<g id="female_shrinkEmbarrassed" /> I had no choice but to run.
"What about Feldan?"
<g id="female_clasphandsRequest" />He refuses to flee, and I'm too shaken to go back. <g id="female_clasphandsLeanPlead" />Please speak with him, and get him to leave before he too becomes Lost.
<g id="female_clasphandsRequest" />You must convince him-- <g id="male_hanghead" priority="high" />it's not worth risking his soul for a handful of material possessions.
<g id="female_clasphandsRequest" />Please, convince old man Olcott to leave. If I don't get him back to town safely... <g id="female_sobbing" />well, I couldn't bear it.
<g id="male_hopeless" />Decades, nearly a century we worked this land, only to have it fall to the Lost.
<g id="male_hopeless" />My family took refuge in town, <g id="male_headShakeNo" />but we have nothing beyond the clothes we wore when we fled.
"Initiate Florina sent me."
<g id="male_itsokay" />Young Florina? This whole venture was her idea. Save your breath, stranger. <g id="female_smackfist" />I'm not leaving with nothing to show for it.
<g id="male_hanghead" />I don't care about the coin, but the memories… <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />if you help me reclaim our keepsakes, I'll go.
"I'll help. You get to safety."

<g id="male_itsokay" />I'll be safe enough right here until you get back. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I've dealt with the Lost before. If you take too long, I'll come in there myself. <g id="female_smackfist" />This is still my farm, you know.

<g id="male_sighAcceptnews" />If you hope to convince me to leave empty-handed,<g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" /> you're wasting your breath. Recover at least some of our family's things… then I will go with you.
<g id="male_sighRelief" />Well now, I was having doubts, but here you are, just as you promised. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />This… means a lot.
"You're welcome."
<g id="male_convince01" />Covenant Initiate Florina returned to Oxboro…<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> discouraged. Perhaps you should speak with her.
<g id="female_sighRelief" />So you made it out of the farm with your soul intact? <g id="female_leanforwardListen" />And I suppose you reclaimed the Olcotts' keepsakes as well?
<g id="female_notsure" />I am ashamed - you kept faith and came through, where I failed. <g id="male_headShakeNo" />Perhaps I am not Covenant material.
"What is the Covenant?"

<g id="female_youknow" />The Covenant is an order of Templars sworn to battle on Aeternum to keep the Spark of hope alive… <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" /> for all eternity. From what I've witnessed,<g id="female_salute2finger" /> you belong as one of us.
Speak with Feldan Olcott
Recover Olcott Family Memories:
Reclaim Keepsakes from supply chests
Collect a Locket from one of the Lost
Collect the Town Crest
Bring the Family Memories to Feldan Olcott
Talk to Florina in Oxboro
<g id="female_headnodding" />I'll return once I have tended to the needs of those stranded here in Oxboro.
<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I do hope we can meet later, in southeastern Everfall at the enclave. <g id="female_explainS" />My brother is there, and I think you two would get along.
<g id="female_explainS" />I strongly recommend that you visit the Covenant Enclave yourself. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />There is something inspiring about the place.
<g id="female_explainS" />In fact, if you don't mind, it would help me greatly if you could take a message to my brother there, Lethold.
The Covenant Enclave

Covenant Initiation Quest: Florina has asked you to visit her brother Lethold at the Covenant enclave in south-eastern Everfall. She has attuned your spirit with the shrine, so you may travel there safely.
"I can do that. What's the message?"
<g id="female_touchhands" />Thank you. Lethold undoubtedly worries for my welfare, <g id="male_spreadarms001" />so please reassure him.

<g id="female_youknowS" />I committed to helping people here in Oxboro for my Covenant initiation, and there's more to be done. Hopefully,<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" /> I'll see you both at the enclave soon.
<g id="female_explainS" />I really do suggest you inquire about becoming a Covenant Initiate yourself. On Aeternum, it's critical one finds a higher purpose to serve.
<g id="female_clasphandsLeanPlead" />Please, good visitor, tell me, have you come from Oxboro?
<g id="female_explainS" />My dear sister Florina embarked on a quest there some time ago,<g id="male_spreadarms001" /> and I am anxious to hear word of her welfare.
"She's still helping people."
<g id="male_sighAcceptnews" />Ah, that's an immense relief to hear. <g id="female_headnodding" />It is inspiring to watch new Initiates face the trials of joining the Covenant.
<g id="male_explain" />But when it's one's younger sister, <g id="male_headShakeNo" />it is impossible not to feel some apprehension.
Travel to the Covenant Enclave
Travel to the Covenant Enclave
(Optional) Use the Spirit Shrine
Covenant Enclave

<g id="male_explain" />If you need shelter, the Covenant Enclave is open to you, as long as you observe our rules.<g id="female_leanforwardListen" /> Any news from Oxboro? I'm awaiting the return of an Initiate named Florina.
<g id="male_explain" />If you have come with hopeful dreams of enlisting with the Covenant yourself, <g id="male_spreadarms001" />it's only fair you know what you're getting into.
<g id="male_shakehead" />A wraith stalks the lands, and some Initiates gave into fear and are now in even greater peril.
Justice and Courage
Covenant Initiation Quest: Lethold beseeches you to rush to Clearview Crypt to end whatever terrible acts are transpiring, save Templar Damiano, and return to him at the Covenant Enclave.
"What happened to the Initiates?"
<g id="male_nodSympathySmall" />Their cowardice has very likely led them to a dark fate, <g id="male_headShakeNo" />though it is neither surprising nor unjust.
<g id="male_explain" />It appears that in their mad flight, they sought refuge in Clearview Crypt,<g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" /> which has now become disturbingly quiet.
"I could go check it out."
<g id="female_cheerFistpump" />Now there's courage! <g id="male_explain" />I should warn you, however, Lumen Morellus believes the Initiates engaged in heretical behavior.

<g id="male_pointsoutthere" />Templar Damiano went after them, but he has not returned. <g id="male_beckonUrgent" />So go then, newcomer. <g id="female_salute2finger" />I have a good feeling about you.

<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I must consult with Lumen Morellus about this alleged heresy. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />I hope you find Damiano, and the Initiates as well. <g id="male_lookDown" />I pray they are still whole.
<g id="male_explain" />The fortitude of Templar Damiano is proven by his safe return,<g id="female_salute2finger" /> though it is your courage that saved him.
<g id="male_think" />It sounds like justice was served with the Initiates. But I wonder, <g id="male_spreadarms001" />how did they succumb to become Corrupted?
"I found this grimoire."
<g id="male_pointAngry" />So they embraced the darkness of their own accord? <g id="female_smackfist" />Then I can only hope they suffered at your hand.
<g id="male_pointAngry" />I will gather any of the Initiates's belongings remaining in the Enclave and see them purged by fire.
Investigate and cleanse Clearview Crypt
Head to Clearview Crypt
Search for Evidence explaining how the Initiates became Corrupted
Free Templar Damiano
Purge Corrupted Presence
<g id="male_explain" />Lumen Morellus would speak with you. She can seem strange, <g id="male_spreadarms001" />but she is one of the most respected members of the order.
<g id="male_explain" />She was my mentor, and I suggest you give great consideration to her words,<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" /> for she is inspired.
The Lumen's Words
Covenant Initiation Quest: Adjudicator Lethold has asked you to speak with Lumen Morellus at the Covenant Enclave for your final initiation test.
"I will listen carefully."

<g id="male_nodunderstand" />Very well. I must attend to cleansing the foul presence of those Initiates from our sacred halls. <g id="female_crossarms" /> When Florina returns, <g id="male_spreadarms001" />I hope all this is far behind us.
<g id="male_convince02" />I suggest you speak with the Lumen soon. <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />There is no reason to delay.

<g id="male_crossarmsUpset" />I've faced down all manner of darkness in my service to the Covenant. But when such darkness comes from within our ranks, <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />it wounds me more than any blade ever could.

<g id="female_beckon" />You are welcome in the Covenant Hall, visitor. <g id="female_explainS" />We keep our gates open at all hours to ensure those in despair or doubt can find the sanctuary they need.
<g id="male_explain" />Remember, it only takes a Spark of hope to ignite the flames of inspiration.
<g id="female_clasphandsGratitude" />Thank you for giving me this chance to express my gratitude for the rescue of Templar Damiano.

<g id="female_headnodding" />I see in your eyes the light of a great potential. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />You would shine as a member of our order, <g id="male_spreadarms001" />and bring inspiration to many struggling souls.
Speak with Morellus.
<g id="female_headnodding" />Be assured, you are under no pressure to join the Covenant, <g id="female_salute2finger" />but you have provided us with a strong case concerning your worthiness.
<g id="female_youknow" />I must ask, however, if you can help me with another matter, <g id="female_leanforwardListen" /> one requiring some discretion.
Inspiration and Redemption
Covenant Initiation Quest: Morellus has enlisted you to lure the Corrupted Templar back to Nettlerest Graveyard, best him in battle, collect his cursed necklace, and return to the Convenant Enclave.
"I can be trusted in such things."
<g id="female_headnodding" />I expected as much. <g id="female_explainS" />The problem I need help with is related to Templar Titus Invectus, the one who oversaw the training of our fallen Initiates.
<g id="female_disagreeCrossarms" />I'm afraid this has driven Titus quite mad, <g id="male_lookDown" />and he, too, is now Corrupted, but through no fault of his own.
"It's spreading…?"

<g id="female_shakeheadNo" />No, because we won't allow that.<g id="female_explainS" /> Paranoia and rage make one susceptible to Corruption, <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />and that's why we'll keep this between us.

<g id="female_crossarms" />The fallen Initiates apparently corrupted the relic Titus wore as a necklace, <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />and we must recover it and destroy it, quickly and quietly.
"How do we do that?"
<g id="female_crossarms" />Templar Invectus lurks somewhere in Nettlerest Graveyard - <g id="male_explain" />there's an old marker there he studied. It should lure him out.
<g id="female_leanpointConvince" />Defeat Invectus, bring back the corrupted relic, and then we can destroy it. <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />Lethold is wrathful enough already.
<g id="female_leanpointConvince" />I strongly suggest you do not attempt to use the relic. <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />It is an insidious poison, Corruption.
<g id="female_sighRelief" />You have recovered the relic from Invectus? Go now, don't say a word. Simply cast it into the pyre.
<g id="female_explainS" />There, now we can safely say this whole sordid affair is concluded with some measure of redemption.
<g id="female_nodding" />Lethold is a champion of righteousness and justice, and a strong leader.
"Are you sure he shouldn't know?"
<g id="female_explainS" />Quite. The Covenant is as much about preserving hope as it is about seeing justice done.
<g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />It is better for all of us that Lethold stays focused on the future, <g id="male_headShakeNo" />no need to dwell on these dark events.
Summon Titus Invectus
Investigate the Nettlerest Graveyard
Align the first stone
Align the second stone
Align the final stone
Defeat {targetName}s to Charge the Marker
Defeat Lost Spirits to Charge the Marker
Light the First Candle
Light the Second Candle
Light the Third Candle
Set the Ritual Marker
Complete the Ritual and Reclaim the Corrupted Templar's Amulet
Reclaim the Corrupted Templar's Amulet
Reclaim the Corrupted Templar's Amulet
Talk to Morellus
Destroy the Relic
<g id="male_nodProud" />You have proven yourself to be faithful and courageous,<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" /> an inspiration for any whose souls are in peril.
<g id="female_nodRelieved" />I hope you will consider joining our order, swearing your allegiance to the Covenant.
<g id="female_thinking" />We must understand the nature of this Corruption and its dark purpose.

<g id="female_spreadarms" />The shadow clouding these lands feels… <g id="male_headShakeNo" />strangely orchestrated. <g id="female_clasphandsLeanPlead" /> Focus, follow the threads, trust your heart and your Covenant brethren.
<g id="female_nodding" />If it comes to it, <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I will stand stalwartly by you and hold this keep until they’ve ground the last brick to dust.
<g id="female_nodRelieved" />In this era of unprecedented darkness, <g id="female_salute2finger" />you are a beacon of hope and inspiration.
<g id="male_fistRaiseLeft" />Together, we have seen justice done, terror and despair purged from within our own ranks.
<g id="male_convince02" />I do hope you will consider committing your skills and courage to the Covenant. You belong with us, friend.
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />We must remain vigilant, always. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />You and I both know only too well, evil can emerge anywhere, even from within our own ranks.
<g id="female_bowHead" />I have learned much from you in your time here.
<g id="female_explainS" />To protect others, we must do so much more than simply keeping them from harm. <g id="female_salute2finger" />Thank you, for leading by example.
<g id="female_sighRelief" />At long last I return from Oxboro. I faltered at Olcott farm. <g id="female_bowHead" />You have my eternal thanks for being there to back me up.

<g id="female_cheerFistpump" />We are stronger with you by our side.<g id="male_explain" /> Holding this terrace, none of those Lost could get past us! Aeternum is brighter with you out there, helping the humblest souls.
<g id="female_worry" />I've heard stories, from the battle against Corruption. <g id="male_lookDown" />It's too horrible to believe.

<g id="female_disappointed" />I once thought that I could save everyone. <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />But that's not the point, is it? It's about helping who we can. That's all we can do.
<g id="female_tiltheadRemember" />The whole enclave is talking about what you've been doing around here!<g id="male_spreadarms001" /> I can't believe we met on the side of a road.
<g id="female_leanpointConvince" />I believe it's time you officially became one of us. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />What do you say?
Committing to the Cause
Covenant Recruitment: You can now join the Covenant.
"Alright. Where do I sign up?"
<g id="female_clenchfistsGetpumped" />I am thrilled to hear you affirm your interest. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />The Covenant will shine brighter with you standing in our ranks.
Go and<g id="female_headnodding" /> speak to Lumen Beyza. I have already vouched for your worthiness. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />And hope be with you… always.
Take<g id="female_youknow" /> your time, this is not a decision to be made lightly.
N/A
Pledge your allegiance to The Covenant
Speak with representative Beyza in the Covenant Enclave and, should you desire, join the Covenant.
(Optional) Decline their offer, for now.
"Thank you. I will think on it."
I understand.<g id="female_headnodding" /> It is an important decision. <g id="male_explain" />Should you wish to join our ranks another time, simply speak with me again.
I know<g id="female_spreadarms" /> Florina would love to hear from you as well.\n(You can switch to this faction with Lumen's help or through the Bio menu.)
Azoth Time Trial
Complete the Azoth Time Trial.
Stay resolute.
No... something isn't right… Why can't I remember what his face looked like?
Don't get too close there, friend. The paint isn't quite dry yet, and I'd hate to stain my hands with your blood.
A potential Initiate? If you value strength, listen well. Don't strike out at whatever suits you in the moment. True power comes from giving that strength a purpose.
How goes the hunt? What wickedness have you put to rest?
Feel free to grab some soup, hon. It gets mighty chilly up here and you'll need something to keep warm.
Good to see you again, hon. I mainly keep this kitchen running for outsiders, but you can still help yourself any time.
Praise the light! My hope was fading fast! I can make it back to the Enclave now!
You have my deepest appreciation for saving me from that foul crypt.
The more we learn about Corruption, the more I understand the things I saw in that cave. What I could have become…
I knew someone like you could not resist our noble cause. The land of Aeternum will be made brighter by your strength. Stay resolute!
<g id="female_spreadarms" />Welcome to the Covenant Enclave. It's a pleasure, but you haven't arrived at the best time...
<g id="female_headnodding" />If you are inclined to join the Covenant, you will need to prove yourself worthy first.
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />I'd ask you to reconsider your faction alignment. We cannot recruit you at this time.
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />I'd ask you to reconsider your faction alignment. We cannot recruit you for one more day.
<g id="female_spreadarms" />Based on what I've heard from Adjudicator Lethold and Lumen Morellus, your courage is incontestable.
<g id="female_headnodding" />If you are ready to swear your allegiance to the Covenant, <g id="male_spreadarms001" />we would welcome you into the Order.
<g id="male_explain" />Now that you have joined our righteous ranks, you'll find we have ample opportunity for spreading the light.
<g id="female_explainS" />Missions are always available here and anywhere on Aeternum where our banner flies. I have Covenant gear, as well.
<g id="female_headnodding" />We'll use all the aid we can get. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />Or, perhaps you would enlist in an even greater conflict?
<g id="male_laughCocky" />Hey! Aren't you a little young to be in here? Don't get touchy, just a wee bit of Aeternum humor for ya! And fear not mate, I'm as discreet as a privy guard!
<g id="male_laughCocky" />Slide on over, friend! You look like one of them Marauder types. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />Like adventure? Maybe a bit of a scrap, aye? How about weapons and riches?
<g id="male_headNodYes" />How’d you like a little tip from ol’ Tibbs?<g id="male_beckonUrgent" /> I’ve got something perfect for a new arrival.
A First Step of Many

Marauder Initiation Quest: Lieutenant Tibbs wants you to collect Lost Ears and a Knight's Signet ring at Lugdunum Fields for some sort of magic and then meet him at the ruin steps to the North of the farm.
"All right, you've got my attention."
<g id="male_fistpumpRight" />That's the spirit! <g id="male_explain" />Northwest's a fort filled with unbelievable wonders. Need odd things to get inside. Magic, you see.
<g id="male_headNodYes" />Ears from the soulless Lost, a ring from a knight. <g id="male_explain" />Grab that lot from Lugdunum Fields, and meet me there.

<g id="male_headShakeNo" />Oi! Won’t get far loitering around here with these louts! <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />Look, you get them ears, and I promise, I’ll show you something special, sure as my name's Tibbs.
<g id="male_concerns" />Oh-ho, that looks like a bag of ears to me! <g id="male_spreadarms001" />You can… leave that there. Now show us the ring… <g id="female_salute2finger" />Well done!
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />You’ve got a strong stomach and bravado! I got an eye for it, I do. Climb the steps, and talk to Gladiator Strou'dahia.

<g id="female_headnodding" />Tibbs spoke of you. He's odd, but fearless. <g id="male_explain" />He has a unique notion of what constitutes honor, but he's a sharp fighter, keeps his enemies off-guard.
<g id="female_headnodding" />Individual freedom is as important to a Marauder as honor and glory.
"Tell me more about the Marauders."
<g id="female_nodYes" />We Marauders are a band of warriors united, seeking glory and honor in battle.
<g id="male_explain" />If you have the spine to stand with us, we may help you to know yourself, <g id="male_spreadarms001" />both your potential and your limitations. Tibbs is your guide, for now.
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />Don’t give me that look, this place is FULL of wonders! <g id="female_leanforwardListen" />Look at me, looking at you, eh!
<g id="male_headNodYes" />The Marauders are my kind of soldiers, see. Family now. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />And I think you should join our crew. Now, how about another tip from Tibbs?
“You mean like your first tip?"

<g id="male_headShakeNo" />Don't be like that! <g id="male_explain" />Had to put you to a little test, didn’t I? <g id="female_leanforwardListen" />Or Strou'dahia would chew you up and spit you out. She's a tougher sort.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />Here now, let's be friends. <g id="female_giveitem" priority="high" />Have a reward for putting up with me!
Follow Tibb's instructions then meet him at the ruins
Collect items from Lugdunum Fields
Speak with Tibbs near the ruins
Explore the Marauder Enclave
Slay Lost for their Ears
Collect a Signet Ring from a Lost Knight
Talk to Lieutenant Tibbs
Climb the steps into the fortress courtyard
Marauder Enclave
Talk to Gladiator Strou'dahia

<g id="female_order" />Walk the grounds and watch. Warriors must train every day, especially on Aeternum. <g id="female_explainS" />If you want to keep up, you will have to prove yourself and challenge your limits.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />Look, I like you mate! <g id="female_headnodding" />And I know what Strou'dahia has cooking for the new recruits.
<g id="male_nod1" />And if you're keen, <g id="female_smackfist" />you could start off with a bang! Short trip, <g id="female_shrugShort" />little warmup, eh? Better loot than Lugdunum to boot.
Fortune Favors
Marauder Initiation Quest: Lieutenant Tibbs has directed you to thrash some pirates and steal some black powder barrels at the Pirate Stockpile and then return to the Marauders Enclave.
"Say ears one more time…"
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />Oi, no, no! Though it is Lost again. <g id="male_noway" />Pirates round here, always a pain in our side.
<g id="male_nod1" />Tracked some of them down yesterday. <g id="male_ragepunchfistsdown" />Northeast, hiding like rats. Fight ’em, plunder ’em, burn their claim, and take their boom.
<g id="male_headNodYes" />Those powder barrels, aye? <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />We’ll be using those to impress Strou'dahia in the next step of our little plan.

<g id="male_goodnews" />Oh ho! Someone's got a mess of booty! <g id="male_fistpumpRight" />Hope you gave those blackguards a good walloping. How’s the prize? <g id="male_spreadarms001" />Ten percent for me then, eh? Fee, tax, and all.
"These were heavy."
<g id="male_pointsoutthere" />A little manual labor’s good for you! <g id="female_crossarms" />Now just remember where you’re off to next.

<g id="male_headShakeNo" />Real rough ones always resurrect, aye? <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />Need a more permanent answer. Plant those barrels near their inner bulwarks, then run like hell!
Raid the Pirate Stockpile
Discipline the Pirates
Plunder the Pirate Hoard
Burn the Pirate Banners
Collect Black Powder Barrels
<g id="male_quidproquo" />We got ourselves a little quid pro quo with Everfall, keeping the Lost out of the hills and off their doorstep.
<g id="male_nod1" />Earns a drink or two. Next one is on Tibbs' tab, eh? <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Good luck out there!
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />You've made it this far, mate, and I can tell you'll fit right in.

<g id="male_nod1" />Strou'dahia wants to test your mettle if you're gonna join us. <g id="female_explainS" /> Swing some steel, blow those bombs, it'll be over in a flash. Recruitment procedures you see.
Threshold Guardian
Marauder Initiation Quest: Lieutenant Tibbs has asked you to speak with Gladiator Strou'dahia at the Marauder Enclave for your final initiation test.
"Sounds like my kind of test."
<g id="male_chuckle" />Oh ho! There it is! Those bombs ain't the only things with spark! <g id="female_explainS" />Now, go talk to Gladiator Strou'dahia, and show the Marauders what you've got!
<g id="male_pointsoutthere" /> Off you trot, mate. <g id="female_crossarms" />Talk to the Doctore and I'll await your return.

<g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />Good, stand before me. You have fought boldly so far. <g id="female_explainS" /> Should you wish to join our ranks I have one final test of strength and skill. It is time. Let us begin.
Speak with Gladiator Strou'Dahia

<g id="male_explain" />When the Varangians first snuck up the cliffs and took Stonekeep, I thought them worthy opponents. <g id="male_crossarmsJudge" />Now they attack those weaker than them and forfeit any honor.
<g id="female_leanforwardListen" />What about you? Would you bleed for the Marauders' cause?
Broken Bones and Blasted Bulwarks

Marauder Initiation Quest: Gladiator Stroudahia has ordered you to best Varangians and rescue captives at Stonereach Keep. You must also complete Tibb's secret mission, before returning to the Marauders' Enclave
"I would fight for glory."
<g id="male_crossarmsJudge" />The Varangians have begun to take some of our members prisoner. <g id="female_smackfist" />No Marauder lets their brethren stay in chains.
<g id="male_explain" />Free the imprisoned recruits who were less fortunate, and take the Varangian Knights down a peg. <g id="female_smackfist" />Make them feel our wrath!
<g id="female_leanforwardListen" />Were it you in captivity, you would hope for a quicker rescue? Suffering festers through inaction.
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />Those who would risk themselves to save their comrades are always welcome in the Marauders.
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />We always stand together, always look after our own. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Now, I know I can trust you in battle.
“Nobody deserves that fate."
<g id="female_headnodding" /> Your little addendum to your mission was noted. <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />That’s the third message Tibbs has sent.
<g id="male_explain" />He's an acquired taste, but a loyal and trustworthy ally. Should you wish to join us, <g id="male_nod1" />Smiggs can enter you into our charters.

<g id="male_nod1" />You have proven yourself a valiant warrior, <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />and have friends here for what you have done.
<g id="female_headnodding" />Eternity is a long time. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Consider spending it with us. There will never be a dull moment.
<g id="female_explainS" />The challenges you face in these lands will mold you. <g id="male_crossarmsJudge" />Forge yourself intently, young one.
Stand strong<g id="female_headnodding" /> alongside your friends. Make your enemies fear your might.
<g id="female_headnodding" />You have shaped yourself into a mighty warrior.

<g id="male_spreadarms001" />Never forget, we are both the iron and the blacksmith, and the act of forging ourselves is never ending. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Hold firm in your mind what you must become.
<g id="male_fistpumpRight" />Well done! Well done indeed! <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />No doubt the fancy folk down in Everfall are all abuzz about that last escapade, my friend.
<g id="female_leanforwardListen" />Reckon I'll be telling that story for an…<g id="male_laughBig" /> Aeternity. Eh? Eh?

<g id="male_complimentplayer" />Did I not say it from the start? I knew you would like it here, mate. <g id="male_nod1" />And always getting stronger, aint'cha? <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I look forward to the mayhem we'll bring.
<g id="male_nod1" />Quite the journey since you first got here. Never could have seen how far you would go. <g id="female_chuckle" />And you, you were mad at me over a few ears!
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />And look at us now! Always got your back, <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />friend, through thick and thin.
UNUSED

<g id="male_waghand02" />The Syndicate. The Covenant. <g id="male_headShakeNo" />Neither suit a combatant of your temperament. <g id="female_beckonLarger" />Join our ranks and become a warrior of legend in these eternal lands.
One of Us
Marauders Recruitment Quest: You can now join the Marauders.
"Alright. Where would I enlist?"

<g id="female_nodYes" />This is good to hear. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I would be honored to fight beside you in the battles ahead. <g id="male_explain" /> I've already spoken with Smiggs. Go to him and he will enter you into our charters.

"Thank you. I will think on it."
<g id="male_headNodYes" />I understand it is an important decision. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Should you wish to join our ranks another time, return and speak with me.
<g id="male_spreadhands" />We always love to see an old mate.\n(You can switch to this faction with Smiggs' help or through the Bio menu.)
Go with honor.
Scram! Food's for Marauders only. If you want to be fed around here, you gotta earn it.
Aye, welcome back and indeed welcome to the crew. There'll be enough stew to feed an army, help yourself any time.
You are new here, yes? Stick around and maybe you learn how to lift.
Keep lifting, trainee. Don't let "good enough" be good enough.
Not sick, are you? I don't have the time to treat outsiders unless you need something amputated. Always have time for that.
As a fellow Marauder, I am required to tell you that I may render first aid upon request. I am not required to tell you how much it will hurt.
Don't forget you come back when you die…
I'm getting out of here before they shove me back in!
Never want to be stuck in a box again. Never thought it could happen to me. One bonk to the head, and BAM! Thanks again for the spring!
They still let me join, even after getting stuck. Perks of being friends with the rep, I suppose. I better pay attention and practice.
Once I finish my training, we are going to absolutely SMASH!
<g id="male_explain" />If you would like to join our crew, you will first need to make your plea to Strou'dahia. <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />You will be challenged, so be prepared.
<g id="male_spreadhands" />I'd ask you to reconsider your faction alignment.<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> We cannot recruit you at this time.
<g id="male_spreadhands" />I'd ask you to reconsider your faction alignment.<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> We cannot recruit you for one more day.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />From the first, we knew you were one of us. <g id="female_leanforwardListen" />It's in the way you carry yourself, you see?
<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Strou'dahia has vouched for your valor, so it's time. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />Pledge our oaths and join our ranks, the choice is yours.
<g id="male_fistRaiseLeft" />Hail, warrior! You are a credit to our ranks.

<g id="female_leanforwardListen" />Do you seek more glory? Look no further. <g id="male_explain" />Missions are available here and anywhere else our banner flies. I also have arms and armor, if you need.
<g id="male_headNodYes" />Aye, looking strong. <g id="male_listenforward" priority="high" />Which noble cause draws you? Or, perhaps you seek assignment to even greater conflict?

Mind your step. <g id="male_gestureAhead" />There are some unnatural beasts in the area. <g id="male_beckonUrgent" />You should return to the safety of the walls. Everfall has been more dangerous as of late.

<g id="female_impatient" />Please, if you wouldn't mind standing aside. I have many problems to unravel. <g id="male_wavehandDismissive" />The Scriveners are always thrilled to challenge hopeful initiates, if you are looking for work.
<g id="male_beckonUrgent" />Please, please, come! You look well-equipped, <g id="male_explain" />and the Syndicate could pay you for your time.
<g id="male_listenforward" priority="high" />I see that you are new to the island? <g id="male_spreadarms001" />Aid me, and perhaps I can shine some light on the darkness.
Fickle Fusions, Fanged Folly
Destroy the wolves for Aventus, and meet him at the Enclave.
Syndicate Initiation Quest: Aventus has hired you to lure the altered wolves to Midnight Den and destroy them, then meet him at the Syndicate Enclave to the north-east when you are finished.
"You offer knowledge?"
<g id="male_nod2" />Yes, and the most valuable kind, indeed, if you assist!

<g id="male_explain" />You see, I've been testing alchemical lures on the local wolves. Results were promising, until one of the wolves consumed the bait... <g id="male_headShakeNo" />and grew in both size and ferocity.
"You're surprised the bait worked?"
<g id="male_dontknow" />I--well--expected that possibility, but not the precise nature of the reaction.

<g id="male_clenchFistRight" />We must annihilate the creature. <g id="male_explain" />Place this lure in their den and fight until the alpha appears. Slay it, <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />then meet me in the enclave for your reward.
<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />Do not feel too sorry for the wolves. <g id="male_explain" />Given the nature of the island, they are a menace in their best state.

<g id="male_goodnews" />Thank you for helping to resolve those, ah, unexpected consequences. We do important work here, studying Azoth's applications. <g id="male_headShakeNo" />But it is not without risks.
<g id="female_beckonLarger" />Please, come in. If you would, introduce yourself to Cleo.
<g id="male_listenforward" priority="high" />Acquaintance of Aventus? His enthusiasm for research is admirable, <g id="male_explain" />but it creates complications from time to time.
<g id="female_explainS" />He must make friends regularly. <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />The Syndicate values those who help him uncomplicate his results.
"Tell me more about the Syndicate."
<g id="female_explainS" />The Syndicate: scholars, arcanists, inventors, explorers of every kind.

<g id="male_listenforward" priority="high" />This land suits the intellectually curious. Those who can handle a measure of danger, <g id="male_spreadarms001" />doubly so. You are welcome here. Return to Aventus.
<g id="female_explainS" />After that mishap with the wolves, <g id="male_patience" />I must return to experimenting and trying anew. A different formula, or perhaps a new approach.
<g id="male_nod1" />Fortunately, research is what this place was built for. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />What I am built for.
"The facilities are impressive."

<g id="male_listenforward" priority="high" />You like them? If you join us in the Syndicate, they will be yours to use. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />Should you be interested, I would like to test your mind as well as your body.

<g id="male_gestureHereweare" />Our very enclave itself is built near something quite special.
Over the Cliffs, and Through the Woods
Syndicate Initiation Quest: Aventus has tasked you to climb the cliffs nearby into Brightwood and east into the grove of the Azoth Tree to collect water from the moat, and then return to him.
"Special and dangerous?"

<g id="male_nodProud" />You're sharp! No progress comes without danger.<g id="female_giveitem" priority="high" /> Take this bottle, mind the cliffs, follow the path into Brightwood. Go through the grove, and then to the moat.
"What am I looking for?"
<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" />Consider that part of your test. You will know when you see it.

<g id="male_listenforward" priority="high" />Oh, one more thing: do not anger the creatures there. <g id="male_crossarmsJudge" />You will find that discretion can often serve you far better than brute force.
<g id="female_explainS" />Climb over the cliffs to the northeast. We have left markers as guides for the initiates.
<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" />Now you've seen the Azoth Tree. It was truly beautiful, no? Well worth a little danger.

<g id="male_nodUnderstand" />I hope you would see its true beauty. Now, if I may have the infused water, <g id="female_giveitem" />here is your payment.
<g id="male_nodUnderstand" />You would make a marvelous member of the Syndicate. However, you must first see an additional member of our order.
Sneak through Brightgrove and collect the Azoth-infused water.

Speak with Cabalist Cleo Elsayad
The impermanence<g id="female_headnodding" /> of death presents a peculiar conundrum when dealing with our adversaries.
<g id="female_thinking" />Let me ask you, how do you kill that which has no life? Well, we of the Syndicate aim to solve that.
Burden of Responsibility
Syndicate Initiation Quest: Cleo has requested that you travel to Broken Hull Hold, pour the sleeping draught into their wells, disrupt their reserves, and return to her at the Syndicate Enclave.
"New problems need new solutions."
<g id="female_nodYes" />Indeed. <g id="male_explain" />This is an Azoth-infused sleeping draught, with which I hope to subdue our immortal foes.
<g id="female_explainS" />Pour it into the wells at Broken Hull Hold, and destroy their reserves to force them to drink it.
"How does sleeping solve that?"
<g id="female_leanforwardListen" />Lost who sleep do not fight. If they do not fight, they do not die. Those who do not die… do not resurrect.
<g id="female_youknow" />The Old World likened death to slumber. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />We are going to turn that metaphor into reality.
<g id="female_thinking" />It is a grim proposition, to be sure.<g id="male_spreadhands" /> But what should be done?
<g id="female_youknow" />You return victorious. <g id="female_salute2finger" />You are truly committed to the application of knowledge, and not just its pursuit.
<g id="female_explainS" />Despite how you may feel about the act itself, <g id="male_spreadarms001" />do know that this work will help the people of Everfall.
“I hope you're right."
<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />As do I. If I am not, we will simply try something else.
<g id="female_headnodding" />Should you wish, we would be honored to have you join our ranks. <g id="male_beckonUrgent" />Speak to Astrid when you're ready. She can begin your initiation.

You're back. She said you'd be back.
When you've been around as long as I have, you start to wonder about the places you aren't supposed to be, the things you aren't supposed to see.
What better place for that special wonder than the Syndicate!
People call me a scoundrel, but I haven't been this happy in ages. Do you know anyone that needs their pockets picked? A temple scouted? A house robbed? Give me a holler!
A newcomer! Care for a drink? I don't get many volunteers these days…
You're looking thirsty. Could I interest you in the latest homebrew? I'm getting few reports of ill effects this time!
How did she get that nickname, they think. Then, BANG! It hits them.
Aye, I am glad you joined us. Never forget the way you reacted when I fired that one round!

<g id="grace_proud" />Winifred Silas, Commander of the Marauders. In this harsh place, only the strongest will survive.

<g id="grace_proud" />Winifred Silas, Commander of the Marauders. In this harsh place, only the strongest will survive.
So many heads to bash. So little time. Stop wasting my time and go out there and stake a claim for yourself!

So many heads to bash. So little time. Stop wasting my time and go out there and stake a claim for yourself!

<g id="female_youknow" />No matter. The next trial will be your last, mark my words.

Near Greyvale Grotto:
Cut down {targetName} in the surrounding area
Defeat Grimclaw and take a Trophy
Best {targetName}

<g id="male_nod1" />You're on your next trial I see. <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />I expect it wasn't a problem for you, you don't look worse for wear. <g id="male_headShakeNo" />Well not any worse than usual. What've you had to do?
"I defeated the bear, Grimclaw."

<g id="male_whattheheckBig" />You had to face Grimclaw? I heard that Silas had it out for you, <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />but I didn't know it was that bad. She shouldn't have set you such a task.
<g id="male_nod1" />I think my hunch was right. <g id="male_patience" />She's up to something. I just have to figure out what.
Marauder: Trial of the Destroyer
Defeat the corrupted ex-marauders in the Great Cleave. Talk to Lieutenant Tibbs at the Marauder Enclave when the task is complete.
"Florent fell to the Corruption?"
<g id="male_nod1" />Unfortunately, yes. <g id="male_rememberBig" />We fought together, honorably, at one time, but due to events in the Great Cleave, he turned.
<g id="male_think" />Gladiator Strou'dahia believes it might have been the influence of an amulet Florent wore.
"Sounds like a dangerous amulet."

<g id="male_nod1" />Indeed, not something we can afford to ignore, and now it's yours to recover. Strou'dahia and I have agreed - <g id="male_pointsoutthere" />this will serve as your trial to earn the rank of Destroyer.
<g id="male_explain" />Careful out there. Great Cleave is treacherous… for all of us. <g id="female_order" />Report to Strou'dahia once you've recovered the amulet.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />Always a welcome sight to see one of our strongest soldiers return from battle. <g id="female_leanforwardListen" />I trust you've recovered Florent's amulet?
"Yes, it was a gift from Silas."

<g id="female_worry" />It came from Silas, eh? That is… disconcerting. <g id="male_lookDown" />Why would she be giving an amulet to a new recruit? <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />I will have a word with her. Meantime, share these tidings with Tibbs.
<g id="female_headnodding" />Though your journey has been difficult, you have handled it well. <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I am proud to see you ascend through the ranks.
<g id="male_casualhail" />Welcome back. So you recovered Florent's amulet? <g id="female_leanforwardListen" />If it was the amulet that caused the old boy to fall, any clues to where it came from?
"Silas gave it to him."

<g id="male_whattheheckBig" />She did? Blast it, never trusted that one! <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" />This is her sick game then, sabotagin' recruits' efforts to advance. <g id="male_complimentplayer" />Good work on your part, now she needs to answer for all this.
Travel to Ostrog Maul and defeat the renegade Corrupted Marauders

Defeat renegade Corrupted Marauders
Recover the Amulet from {targetName}
Read the journal of Ravager Florent
Marauder: Trial of the Commander

Defeat Corrupted Commander Silas and return the corrupted amulet to prove you're worthy to advance to the rank of Commander. Talk to Lieutenant Tibbs at the Marauder Enclave when the task is complete.
"Silas has fallen to the Corruption?"
<g id="female_headnodding" />Silas gave into fury and pride, and embraced Corruption. It's a stain on the honor of all Marauders. I'm sorry to say that Silas still wears an amulet awarded to her.
"Should the amulet be recovered?"

<g id="male_rememberBig" />Yes, the anger and callous soul within her led her to this, but the amulet enabled her. <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />The relic was cursed, but Corruption found a way to her through it.
<g id="female_order" />Bring back the amulet, prove yourself worthy of being a Commander.
<g id="female_liftHandsXs" />Our task is grim, but the Marauders must take the difficult path, even when dealing with those we do not like.
<g id="male_explain" />Silas was a good Marauder for all her faults. <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" />But allowing the Corruption to overtake you is inexcusable.
<g id="female_nodConsider" />It is done then? Ah yes, this amulet is a symbol of your accomplishment. <g id="male_complimentplayer" />You have served as an exemplar of the tenets we adhere to.
<g id="female_cheerFisthigh" />Let this be a lesson to all those who strive for greatness in the Marauders.
"I strive to be the best Marauder."
<g id="female_headnodding" />Very good, Commander. But let us not forget Silas,<g id="male_patience" /> she serves as an example as well, but for the path of darkness.

<g id="male_explain" />The path that those who seek strength alone may fall into, <g id="male_spreadarms001" />that we all may fall into, <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />if we are not vigilant.
Defeat the Corrupted Commander Silas and retrieve the signet ring in {POITags} to earn the rank of Commander
Defeat {targetName}
Collect the Corrupted Amulet

<g id="male_headShakeNo" />I still can't believe she stole it, my only memory of Florent. <g id="female_explainS" />He was the best of us and it was a way for me to remember the old days we spent together.
"She took it from you?"

<g id="male_hanghead" priority="high" />She took it while I wasn't looking. <g id="female_shrinkEmbarrassed" />Distracted me when she came over here, said something about how it would make her stronger.
<g id="male_dontknowS" />Couldn't figure what that meant, all I care about is the memory of my comrade.
Marauder: Trial of the Champion
Brave the dangers of Brimstone Sands and Hornhold to prove you're worthy to advance to the rank of Champion. Talk to Gladiator Strou'dahia at the Marauder Enclave when the task is complete.
"I'm always ready for a challenge."
<g id="female_headnodding" />As a Commander of the Marauders, you have the chance to become one of the very best of the Marauders.
<g id="male_explain" />But I have a new trial, a station that has not been achieved for generations. A true Champion.
"A champion?"
<g id="female_nodYes" />Yes, and you will prove it by hunting the Khelone Khelydorea, the Colossus of Qebui, and Sividus the Armored Drake.
<g id="female_order" />From each you will claim a trophy and prove yourself worthy of the title of Champion of the Marauders.
<g id="female_headnodding" />Many have failed at this trial, so I do not have to tell you twice to think with a keen mind and a cautious eye. The rest... Well, that is up to you.
<g id="female_headnodding" />I see you have spoken with Tibbs. The look on his face was all that I needed.
<g id="female_headnodding" />I will take the trophies that you earned. The Marauders will keep them as a reminder of what you have accomplished.
"I earned my title."
<g id="female_liftHandsXs" />That you did, it is done, and you have earned this right. <g id="female_bowHead" />You are now a Champion of the Marauders.
<g id="female_liftHandsXs" />It is usually a cause for celebration, but given the grim situation of the fall of First Light, ceremony will need to wait.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />You've done a great deal for the Marauders.<g id="female_leanforwardListen" /> Did I hear right that you started the Trial of the Champion?
<g id="male_nod1" />You know that's a rare opportunity, not many get the chance to even participate.
"I just defeated them actually."
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />Hah! That doesn't surprise me one bit. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />You haven't faltered at any challenges thrown your way.
<g id="male_pointsoutthere" />Let any Marauder argue against your worthiness and you'll have a hundred more singing your praises.
Collect the coins at Hornhold and defeat the Armored Drake in {POITags} to earn the rank of Champion

Syndicate: Trial of the Scrivener
Defeat Lost Gheist Malikor and use the Psychokinetic Absorber to capture any ectoplasm to earn the rank of Scrivener. Talk to Alchemist Krockes at the Syndicate Enclave when the task is complete.
"I am. What must I do?"
<g id="male_headNodYes" />You have arrived at the perfect moment, <g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />for I am ready to test my new Psychokinetic Absorber.
<g id="male_explain" />Did you know that some of the Lost still possess small traces of their souls?
"Are you sure about that?"
<g id="male_explain" />Yes. We just proved the hypothesis by examining one of our Lost captives. <g id="female_order" />Find Gheist Malikor. He was quite formidable in life, so be wary.
<g id="female_giveitem" priority="high" />Use the Psychokinetic Absorber and strike him down. You'll see!
<g id="male_explain" />Have you located Malikor yet? He's somewhere out there. <g id="male_beckonUrgent" />Use the Absorber and bring back the traces of his soul!
<g id="male_smile" />Ah, at last! Yes, yes, you see? There are traces of Malikor's soul in here! This could change everything!
<g id="male_fistpumpRight" />This device will surely cause a revolution in our studies of the Lost!
"Does this mean I'm a Scrivener?"
<g id="male_fistpumpRight" />Ah right, yes! You have done well, and I am pleased to promote you to the rank of Scrivener!
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />Great well, now I must study these results, the work never ends my friend!

Syndicate: Trial of the Chronicler
Gather ectoplasm and soul traces from the various Lost in Periville and return to Alchemist Krockes at the Syndicate Enclave to earn the rank of Chronicler.
"Will you give me the trial again?"
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />After our first success? <g id="male_complimentplayer" />Of course! I consider you a most audacious companion!
<g id="male_explain" />Gather up specimens from Periville, and let us repeat our experiment on a new subject.
"How is this different?"
<g id="male_explain" />Ah- well you see, I've made some slight adjustments. This shouldn't be anything noticeable in the appearance, but rest assured it is improved.
<g id="male_headNodYes" />Just don't go shaking it around too much, still a bit finnicky at times.
<g id="male_explain" />Gather the specimens for our work in the Fen, and then I will see you advanced in rank.
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />Really? You got all of it? And rather quickly too, I think. <g id="male_complimentplayer" />Your abilities once again prove you are an invaluable resource!
"Happy to help."
<g id="male_headNodYes" />With these in hand, the things we might accomplish are innumerable! I just need time.
<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />And for your contribution, you have earned your new rank.<g id="female_bowHead" /> Congratulations, Chronicler {playerName}.

Syndicate: Trial of the Cabalist
Place Psychokinetic Absorbers at strategic points in Mourningdale to earn the rank of Cabalist. Talk to Alchemist Krockes at the Syndicate Enclave when the task is done.
"Are you okay?"
<g id="male_headNodYes" />Oh right, yes of course, <g id="male_rememberBig" />I am doing perfectly well. I just was distracted.
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />It matters not, we have yet another prototype to test. <g id="male_explain" />This time, a unique one that must be tested in Mourningdale!
"And what shall I do?"

<g id="male_explain" />Place and activate them, if you will, in the strategic points along Mourningdale's leylines. <g id="male_complimentplayer" />You're no stranger to these devices, so it should go swimmingly.
<g id="male_headNodYes" />Ah yes as well, additional specimen will need to be gathered.
<g id="male_explain" />Those Psychokinetic Absorbers won't place themselves. <g id="female_smackfist" />The sooner, the better. The research never ends, my friend!

<g id="male_headNodYes" />Perfect! Perfect! <g id="male_complimentplayer" />You have accomplished quite the feat, and this harvest will be invaluable to me-- <g id="female_bowHead" />and the Syndicate of course.
<g id="male_explain" />But I must collect them, yes I must soon.
"Are you sure everything is okay?"
<g id="male_explain" />Yes, yes, you deserve this. I mean, your title. <g id="male_complimentplayer" />We will be remembered for all time in our accomplishments, no matter what Cleo says!
<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />Er- and you are a Cabalist too now! Congratulations.

Syndicate: Trial of the Alchemist

Defeat Alchemist Krockes and absorb his soul into the Psychokinetic Absorber and then return it to Cleo Elsayad to earn the rank of Alchemist. Talk to Cleo Elsayad at the Syndicate Enclave when the task is complete.
"How did it happen?"
<g id="male_patience" />The way it always does with the undisciplined. <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />Too enamored of their research and their reputation.
<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />Krockes was simply not strong-minded enough. <g id="female_leanforwardListen" />You are ready to face your final trial, are you not?
"I am. What must I do?"
<g id="female_nodYes" />You must learn to clean up the messes you've made.

<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />Krockes is not only Lost, he's harnessing soul power. <g id="female_smackfist" />He must be destroyed. Immediately. <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />It's the only way to set things right.
<g id="female_youknow" />When you find Krockes, don't hesitate. <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />I suspect he has become quite… volatile.
<g id="female_liftHandsXs" />Then the deed is done? Krockes is no more? Well done!

<g id="female_headnodding" />The integrity of our research must be preserved. <g id="male_complimentplayer" />You have served with distinction and earned the rank of Alchemist. <g id="female_salute2finger" />Congratulations!

Syndicate: Trial of the Magus

Venture to Tempestas Custodia to obtain the work of Syndicate Researcher Sigurdsson and return it to Cleo Elsayad to earn the rank of Magus. Talk to Cleo Elsayad at the Syndicate Enclave when the task is complete.
"We should study it."

<g id="female_headnodding" />Ah yes, <g id="male_explain" />well you see there had been Syndicate researchers dispatched to study these sites. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />One of particular interest was called Tempestas Custodia.
<g id="female_explainS" />A researcher named Sigurdsson volunteered to delve further into the site.
"And what happened to Sigurdsson?"

<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />He has not been heard from in some time, and the research he was performing is invaluable. <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />I am sure he would wish for us to preserve his findings.
<g id="female_explainS" />Travel to Tempestas Custodia in Elysian Wilds and locate his research.
<g id="female_liftHandsXs" />Sigurdsson was a fine researcher, but I do wonder if he was in over his head in the Elysian Wilds.
<g id="female_explainS" />The Syndicate's mission often requires us to visit such untamed lands.
<g id="female_liftHandsXs" />Well done, I knew that you could be trusted with such a monumental task. You will be named a Magus immediately.
<g id="female_explainS" />And so shall Sigurdsson, should he ever return. Hope springs eternal here in Aeternum, after all.
"And what happened to Sigurdsson?"
<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />He has not been heard from in some time, and the research he was performing is invaluable. I am sure he would wish for us to preserve his findings.
<g id="female_headnodding" />Travel to Tempestas Custodia in Elysian Wilds and locate his research.

Covenant: Trial of the Templar

Track down the Apostate Covenant Initiate Bremen Luca and attempt to discover what happened to him to advance to the rank of Templar. Talk to Templar Roose at the Covenant Enclave when the task is complete.
"I am ready. What do I do?"
<g id="female_headnodding" />An Initiate, like yourself, has asked some uncomfortable questions. <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />A few that, I'm afraid, we cannot allow.
<g id="female_headnodding" />He was named an Apostate, and it seems<g id="female_sympathyHandsheart" /> in his despair that he's fallen Lost. We must lay him to his final rest.
"Lay him to rest?"

<g id="female_headnodding" />Yes, it's grim business to be certain, yet we must complete it with dignity. <g id="male_hanghead" priority="high" />He was of our number and though he became Lost, we shall remember him.
<g id="female_clasphandsConvince" />If you can, bring back any tokens or memories for his next of kin.
<g id="female_clasphandsConvince" />Find the Apostate and offer him his final rest. May he at last find peace, at least for some time.
<g id="female_beckon" />Ah, you have returned! I have taken over the Trial. Adjudicator Roose is otherwise occupied.
<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />I am Livia Luca, Covenant Adjudicator. If that name sounds familiar it is because I am the mother of Bremen Luca.
"I found his journal pages."

<g id="female_notsure" />These pages are from my son you say? <g id="male_lookawayGuilty" priority="high" />Well… thank you for retrieving his last testament, Templar. Unfortunately, our leadership's judgment is final.
<g id="female_headnodding" />It seems there is quite a bit I must make sense of.

Covenant: Trial of the Excubitor
Find the second page of the journal of Bremen Luca to advance to the rank of Excubitor. Talk to Livia Luca at the Covenant Enclave when the task is complete.
"What did his writings say?"
<g id="female_worry" />Something of grave concern. My son was named an Apostate, yet he was not the only one excommunicated from the Covenant.
<g id="female_shakeheadNo" />I fear this runs deeper than I thought. <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />I believe that there was a conspiracy against my son.
"Do we bring this to leadership?"

<g id="female_shakeheadNo" />No, unfortunately I don’t know who is responsible for condemning Bremen. This will be your next trial. <g id="female_order" />Go to Weaver's Fen and find my son's journal.
<g id="female_headnodding" />Bring back any other evidence you find. And please, keep this between us.
<g id="female_order" />Travel the Fen and find what my son was investigating. <g id="male_patience" />Then I will grant you the rank of Excubitor. Remember, we must not tell the others.
<g id="female_thinking" />You found this page? And… prayer beads? These are beads of the Covenant. That must mean these were once Covenant members.
<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />I'm afraid this has much darker implications than I originally thought.
"What do you believe this means?"

<g id="female_thinking" />There must be someone responsible, but who? <g id="male_headShakeNo" />I apologize that this is not your normal trial you were expecting. But rest assured that you are an Excubitor now.
<g id="female_headnodding" />Well done, and we will talk more soon I expect.

Covenant: Trial of the Lumen
Find Bremen Luca's journal at Hollowing Fort and recover Prayer Beads from Corrupted Templars to earn the rank of Lumen. Talk to Adjudicator Luca at the Covenant Enclave when the task is complete.
"Yes, I am prepared."
<g id="female_thinking" />I have continued piecing together the fragments of my son's journals. He mentioned someone called Templar Ambrose who went to Great Cleave.
<g id="female_headnodding" />I don’t know him, but I need you to find out more. <g id="female_crossarms" priority="high" />With him lies the answers.
"I'll visit him in Great Cleave"
<g id="female_thinking" />I suspect he may have more of my son's writings, almost as if Bremen was leaving us a trail.

<g id="male_explain" />And bring back more prayer beads as proof Templar Ambrose has fallen to Corruption. <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />I believe we are close to the answers we seek.
<g id="female_clasphandsGratitude" />Your help has been invaluable to me, and to the entire Covenant.
<g id="female_headnodding" />We will uncover the truth, and your valor will be recognized. But first, we must find the evidence.

<g id="female_headnodding" />This was when he made a discovery about some of the leaders, then. <g id="male_rememberBig" />He uncovered the fallen of the Covenant, and they punished him for seeking the truth.
<g id="female_thinking" />It all started with this Templar Ambrose, his fall started Bremen's path.
"I'm sorry for what happened."
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />You have helped make things right. <g id="female_bowHead" />I'd expect nothing less from a Lumen of the Covenant.
<g id="female_worry" priority="high" />I will resolve to find out who was responsible for this, and ensure it never happens again. <g id="female_salute2finger" />Thank you, Lumen, you are dismissed.

Covenant: Trial of the Adjudicator
Lay Corrupted Adjudicator Luca to rest and find Adjudicator Roose to earn the rank of Adjudicator. Talk to Lethold at the Covenant Enclave when the task is complete.
"Livia Luca? What happened?"

<g id="male_sighAcceptnews" />Our scouts report that she has turned to the Corruption. <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />If that is the case, she must be dealt with, and it may mean that Adjudicator Roose is in peril as well.
<g id="male_sighAcceptnews" />This is no mean task, but... you must track down Luca.
"I must face her?"
<g id="male_handheart" />Indeed. She is... was... a member of the Covenant. <g id="male_lookDown" />But our justice must be swift if she has turned.
<g id="male_sighAcceptnews" />And if Adjudicator Roose is with her, we need to ensure her safety. This will be your next trial. <g id="female_order" />See that it is done.

<g id="male_handheart" />I shudder to think Luca might have fallen, but we must do what is necessary for the Covenant. <g id="female_smackfist" />May justice be swift for those who turn to Corruption.

<g id="male_handheart" />It's done, then? Perhaps she will find peace in death. <g id="female_leanforwardListen" />And I see that Adjudicator Roose has returned. You have done what has been asked of you and more.
"I did right by the Covenant."
<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" />She and her son were members of the Covenant. <g id="male_explain" />We will address this vendetta against Bremen with those who conspired against him.
<g id="male_nodSympathySmall" />He was an exemplar of good, a lesson to us all. <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />Now we must strive to save those who are left.
